title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ORLANDO – On a night when one team featured a Hall of Fame center, it was the other’s young, explosive guard who authored a performance for the ages.

Anfernee “Penny” Hardaway, in a stunning virtuoso display, powered the Orlando Magic to a 103-90 victory over the Houston Rockets, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 42 points. From the opening tip, it was clear Hardaway was operating on a different plane.

The Magic guard was a whirlwind of offensive creativity, slicing through the Rockets’ defense with an array of drives, pull-ups, and impossible finishes. He was the engine of the Orlando offense, and when his team needed a bucket to stem any Houston momentum, Hardaway delivered. His 42-point outburst wasn't just a high volume of shots; it was an efficient and breathtaking dissection of a respected opponent.

While Hardaway’s historic night rightfully stole the spotlight, the Magic received vital contributions from the rest of their starting lineup. Horace Grant provided a rock-solid 16 points, and Nick Anderson’s 15 points offered crucial secondary scoring. Dennis Scott and Rony Seikaly also cracked double figures, forming a complete team effort that supported their superstar’s magnificent night.

The Rockets, led by the legendary Hakeem Olajuwon’s 24 points and 11 rebounds, simply had no answer for the Hardaway onslaught. Clyde Drexler added 18 points, but Houston’s attempts to mount a comeback were consistently extinguished by another dazzling Hardaway basket.

In the end, the story was singular and undeniable: Anfernee Hardaway, with a record-setting 42 points, put the entire league on notice and carried his Orlando Magic to a decisive and memorable home victory. It was a night that would be etched into the franchise’s history books.
